title: Street Sambo by Brett Jacques 1999
description:
Most of the commonly taught groundfighting techniques that win matches on gym mats or in the ring simply don't work on concrete, asphalt, or broken glass. Add a knife, gun, or multiple attackers to the situation and your dojo grappling techniques are likely to get you killed.
To survive and win a real world ground fight, you need a martial art designet to cope with the real world. You need Sambo - an explosive blend of striking, throwing and grappling methods specifically designed to fight and win against armed opponents, physically superior opponents, and multiple attackers. In this groundbreaking three-disc video series, Sambo expert Dr. Brett Jacques teaches you how to use this devastating art to defeat dozens of common street attacks. He also reveals the secrets of Sambo's dynamic groundfighting techniques, including escapes and reversals from the mount and guard positions, bone breaking submission and finishing holds, and never-before-seen information on grappling with armed opponents.

(C) Paladin Press 1999

01 - Introduction
02 - Stances and zoning concepts
03 - Control points and balance
04 - Sambo kinesiology
05 - Basic skills part 1
06 - Basic skills part 2
07 - Sambo self-defense
08 - Sambo groundfighing
09 - Grappling with weapons
10 - Defenses from disadvanged position
11 - Defenses against weapons
12 - Multiple attackers
13 - Conclusion
